meanings.definition: Relating to or using signals or information represented by a continuously variable physical quantity.
meanings.sent1: The old radio had an analog dial for tuning.
meanings.sent2: An analog clock shows time using hands on a face.
meanings.sent3: The analog thermometer decided it was too hot and ran away!
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like an analog signal, fluctuating constantly.
meanings.sent5: The analog sound of the vinyl record was warm and rich.

meanings.definition: A person or thing seen as comparable to another.
meanings.sent1: She is an analog of her mother, both in looks and behavior.
meanings.sent2: The relationship between the two countries is like an analog of history repeating itself.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the dog was an analog of a giant mouse!
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was an analog for success in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The tree's growth served as an analog for personal development.
